result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

chargeModifiers.descr: Domestic Abuse - Infliction of Physical Pain or Injury

records.addlTxt:
Defense has moved to withdraw bail motion request. Case is removed from today's calendar.
Case remains scheduled for a status conference on 11-11-22 at 8:30 am.
Request to Withdraw Bail Motion, filed.
Bail review scheduled for 10-25-22 at 8:30 am is rescheduled to 10-31-22 at 1:30 pm due to victim notification. Parties agreed upon new date via email.
Notice of Motion and Motion for Bail Reduction or Modification, signed and filed.
At the request of the defense, case is scheduled for a bail review on 10-25-22 at 8:30 am by zoom.  Parties agreed upon new court date by email.

Defendant Jonathon T Brown not in court, in custody.  Attorney Tedia K. Gamino appeared by video for Jonathon T Brown.  Attorney Jacob A. Maule in court for State of Wisconsin. 
Case in court for a calendar call.  Defendant is in custody.  Court vacates previously issued stayed bench warrant.  Defense does not have discovery or and offer and is requesting a status conference. Case is adjourned to 11-11-22 at 8:30 am for status conference by zoom.
This hearing may be streamed live on DAcast at the discretion of the Court:

Status conference scheduled for November 11, 2022 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Jonathon T Brown not in court.  Attorney Tedia K. Gamino appeared by video for Jonathon T Brown.  Prosecuting attorney Jacob A. Maule in court for the State of Wisconsin. 
Case in court for a pretrial conference.  Defendant does not appear.  Court issued a bench warrant STAYED until the next court date.  Case is adjourned to 10-11-22 at 8:30 am for a calendar call by zoom.
Calendar call scheduled for October 11, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Br.10 clerk notified Courts down 09/02/22 @08:30. Notified all parties via email. Next court date re-scheduled to 09/12/22 @08:30am Br.10

Court ordered no contact with AZJ (DOB 8/10/00)
No Contact/No Weapons Order, signed and filed.
Court ordered defendant TURNED OVER TO Justice Point for SUPERVISION Level 5.  No possession of dangerous weapons or firearms.

ADDRESS INFO for Jonathon T Brown
Current: 1750 N 56th Street, Milwaukee, WI 53216   (Effective: 08-11-2022)
Prior: 6201 West Carmen Avenue #3, Milwaukee, WI 53218

Defendant Jonathon T Brown in court with attorney Luis Javier Irizarry Lugo.  Defendant Jonathon T Brown in custody.  Karine O'Byrne appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Havas, Branch 10.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause.  Defendant advised of right to counsel and complaint given to defendant's attorney.  Defendant plead not guilty.  DEFENDANT IS NOT ELIGIBLE FOR PUBLIC DEFENDER REPRESENTATION.  
This hearing may be streamed live on DAcast at the discretion of the Court: https://iframe.dacast.com/live/4dafbf46-ed15-c11c-fa22-a58262833632/d84cd54a-763c-3a58-15a9-b84acf306616  Pre-trial conference scheduled for September 2, 2022 at 08:30 am.
